decision_conditions: The proposed change of use, combined with the existing non-retail uses in this parade of shops, would be harmful to the vitality and viability of the Retail Core of Rainham Minor District Centre and contrary to the provisions of Policy Dc16 of the Local Development Framework. Therefore it is considered under paragraph C.2 (f) (ii), Class C, Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and/or re-enacting that Order) that Prior Approval should be refused.

The proposed change of use, including the opening hours, would create significant levels of noise and disturbance caused by customers entering and leaving the premises, particularly during the weekday evening and weekend hours of operation, harmful to the residential amenity of adjacent occupiers, particularly No.'s 16A, 16B to 26A and 26B Upminster Road South and contrary to the provisions of Policy DC61 of the Local Development Framework.Therefore it is considered under paragraphs C.2 (a) and (d), Class C, Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and/or re-enacting that Order) that Prior Approval should be refused.
description: Change of use from A1 (retail) to A3 (restaurant). Mon to Sat 11am to 11pm, Sun 10am to 11pm.'PRIOR APPROVAL'
